means: （违法犯罪团伙的）头目，首恶，元凶

sentence.Network_en: He spilled it that Bill was their ringleader.
sentence.Network_cn: 他透露比尔是他们的主谋.

sentence.Network_en: To catch bandits , first catch the ringleader.
'He's the cook ; and the ringleader, too.'
sentence.Network_cn: “ 他是船上的厨子, 也是那帮家伙的头目. ”

the criminal liability of the ringleader in the criminal group ., 论犯罪集团首要分子的刑事责任.

list.abs: in the Soviet Union , when college students create trouble , the practice is to expel a few ringleaders , and it is not realized that bad things can serve us as teaching material .苏联大学生闹事，他们就开除几个领袖人物，他们不懂得坏事可以当作教材，为我们所用。
新词直译_languagem... ... 解套 cut paper losses,extricate oneself 血头 blood-sale ringleader 谐音成语 homophonic idiom.
suspected ringleader of madrid bombings dies in explosion ., 马德里炸弹疑凶首领死于爆炸.
the accused ringleader of the 2004 Madrid train bombings has been acquitted . the three lead defendants were found guilty of mass murder and other charges .造成2004年马德里火车爆炸案的犯罪团伙头目被宣布无罪释放，另有三名主犯被判谋杀等罪。

entry.tran: 挑起争端者;头目;首恶;魁首
entry.def: The ringleaders in a quarrel, disturbance, or illegal activity are the people who started it and who cause most of the trouble.

example.ex: The soldiers were well informed about the ringleaders of the protest.
example.tran: 士兵们对这次抗议活动的带头者已经了如指掌。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who leads (especially in illicit activities)
